FFDENetwork

Class FFDEEventDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • FFDENetwork.FFDEEventDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FFDEObservable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class FFDEEventDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, FFDEObservable
    Created by JM on 27.03.2016. The heart of event distribution in FFDENetwork.FFDEServer. Usage:
    • events get registered when they get their first observer
    • events which are not observed get to the archive
    • when an event is reported all its observers are immediately notified
    • observers are updated by multiple threads simultaneously
    • one observer can observe more than one event coming from dispatcher

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        overrides run() from Runnable. Inside this method the Dispatcher watches its event queue and when an event appears it immediately attempts to assign one of its worker events to update all observers associated with the event.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
